me.adaptive.arp.api

Interface IFile

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAdaptiveRP, IBaseData

    public interface IFile
extends IBaseData
    Interface for Managing the File operations
    Since:
    v2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface me.adaptive.arp.api.IAdaptiveRP

        IAdaptiveRP.Group

    • Method Detail

      • isDirectory

        boolean isDirectory(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Check whether this is a path of a file.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        Returns:
        true if this is a path to a folder/directory, false if this is a path to a file.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • exists

        boolean exists(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Check whether the file/path exists.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        Returns:
        True if the file exists in the filesystem, false otherwise.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • delete

        boolean delete(FileDescriptor descriptor,
               boolean cascade)
        Deletes the given file or path. If the file is a directory and contains files and or subdirectories, these will be deleted if the cascade parameter is set to true.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        cascade - Whether to delete sub-files and sub-folders.
        Returns:
        True if files (and sub-files and folders) whether deleted.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • create

        void create(FileDescriptor descriptor,
            IFileResultCallback callback)
        Creates a file with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        callback - Result of the operation.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • mkDir

        boolean mkDir(FileDescriptor descriptor,
              boolean recursive)
        Creates the parent path (or paths, if recursive) to the given file/path if it doesn't already exist.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        recursive - Whether to create all parent path elements.
        Returns:
        True if the path was created, false otherwise (or it exists already).
        Since:
        v2.0

      • listFiles

        void listFiles(FileDescriptor descriptor,
               IFileListResultCallback callback)
        List all the files contained within this file/path reference. If the reference is a file, it will not yield any results.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        callback - Result of operation.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • listFilesForRegex

        void listFilesForRegex(FileDescriptor descriptor,
                       java.lang.String regex,
                       IFileListResultCallback callback)
        List all the files matching the speficied regex filter within this file/path reference. If the reference is a file, it will not yield any results.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        regex - Filter (eg. *.jpg, *.png, Fil*) name string.
        callback - Result of operation.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • getContent

        void getContent(FileDescriptor descriptor,
                IFileDataLoadResultCallback callback)
        Loads the content of the file.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        callback - Result of the operation.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • setContent

        void setContent(FileDescriptor descriptor,
                byte[] content,
                IFileDataStoreResultCallback callback)
        Sets the content of the file.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        content - Binary content to store in the file.
        callback - Result of the operation.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • canWrite

        boolean canWrite(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Determine whether the current file/folder can be written to.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        Returns:
        True if the folder/file is writable, false otherwise.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • canRead

        boolean canRead(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Determine whether the current file/folder can be read from.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        Returns:
        True if the folder/file is readable, false otherwise.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • move

        void move(FileDescriptor source,
          FileDescriptor destination,
          boolean createPath,
          boolean overwrite,
          IFileResultCallback callback)
        Moves the current file to the given file destination, optionally overwriting and creating the path to the new destination file.
        Parameters:
        source - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation as source.
        destination - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation as destination.
        createPath - True to create the path if it does not already exist.
        callback - Result of the operation.
        overwrite - True to create the path if it does not already exist.
        Since:
        v2.0

      • getSecurityType

        IFileSystem.FileSecurity getSecurityType(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Returns the security type of the file
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.
        Returns:
        Security Level of the file
        Since:
        v2.0

      • getFileType

        IFileSystem.FileType getFileType(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Returns the file type
        Parameters:
        descriptor - File descriptor of file or folder used for operation.

        Returns the file type of the file
        Since:

        IFileSystem.FileStorageType getFileStorageType(FileDescriptor descriptor)

        Parameters:
